 Sent: Wednesday, November 28, 2007 3:56 PM

469 HackII Lives!



  I wrote the code for a pseudo-random number generato=
r using a PIC some 
  years ago. I'll see if I can dig it up.

  Zack

  On=
 Wed, 28 Nov 2007, Frank Sumption wrote:

  >
  > Now all we need is a pic =
chip to output random numbers which can be used to turn on and off switches=
 that allow fixed tones through to a mixer/amplifier---Instant Spiricom! I'=
m thinking use op amp square wave generators, and switch them in and out us=
ing something like the old 4066 chips. The goal being to have a system that=
 works without the presence of radio stations, such as remote investigation=
s, and eliminate the concern that we're just creating the messages in our m=
inds trying make sense out of random voice fragments.
  >
  > Frank-S
  >
